main event: On 29 March 1955, in Pendleton, Oregon, a civilian witnessed two visible objects with three separate flashes lasting approximately 2 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed for 15 minutes, traveling at flight speeds of approximately 4500 M.P.H. at an elevation of approximately 45 degrees.
The objects emitted a light orange color and had no visible trail or propulsion system.
The conclusion classified the sighting as 'Probable A/C', which stands for 'Probable Balloon'.
The presence of two visible objects and three separate flashes adds complexity to the sighting.
The document includes a statement from Major Robert O. Gallup of the case investigation team concerning the sighting near Pendleton, Oregon.
sighted object: two visible objects with three separate flashes lasting approximately 2 minutes
